SEARCH
Package com.landawn.abacus.util

Class Futures

java.lang.Object
com.landawn.abacus.util.Futures
public final class Futures extends Object
The Futures class provides utility methods for working with Future objects. These methods include combining multiple Future objects, creating a Future that completes when all input Futures complete, creating a Future that completes when any input Future completes, and iterating over a collection of Futures.
See Also:
  • ContinuableFuture
  • CompletableFuture
  • ExecutorCompletionService

  • Method Details

    • compose

      public static <T1, T2, R> ContinuableFuture<R> compose(Future<T1> cf1, Future<T2> cf2, Throwables.BiFunction<? super Future<T1>,? super Future<T2>,? extends R,Exception> zipFunctionForGet)
      Composes two futures into a new ContinuableFuture that completes when both input futures complete. The result of the new ContinuableFuture is determined by applying the provided function to the results of the two input futures.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - The result type of the first input future.
      T2 - The result type of the second input future.
      R - The result type of the new ContinuableFuture.
      Parameters:
      cf1 - The first input future.
      cf2 - The second input future.
      zipFunctionForGet - The function to be applied to the results of the two input futures.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when both input futures complete, with a result computed by the provided function.

    • combine

      public static <T1, T2> ContinuableFuture<Tuple.Tuple2<T1,T2>> combine(Future<? extends T1> cf1, Future<? extends T2> cf2)
      Combines two futures into a new ContinuableFuture that completes when both input futures complete. The result of the new ContinuableFuture is a Tuple2 containing the results of the two input futures.
      Type Parameters:
      T1 - The result type of the first input future.
      T2 - The result type of the second input future.
      Parameters:
      cf1 - The first input future.
      cf2 - The second input future.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when both input futures complete, with a result being a Tuple2 of the results of the two input futures.

    • allOf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> ContinuableFuture<List<T>> allOf(Future<? extends T>... cfs)
      Returns a new ContinuableFuture that is completed when all of the given Futures complete. If any of the given Futures complete exceptionally, then the returned ContinuableFuture also does so.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The array of input futures.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when all input futures complete.

    • allOf

      public static <T> ContinuableFuture<List<T>> allOf(Collection<? extends Future<? extends T>> cfs)
      Returns a new ContinuableFuture that is completed when all of the given Futures complete. If any of the given Futures complete exceptionally, then the returned ContinuableFuture also does so.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The collection of input futures.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when all input futures complete.

    • anyOf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> ContinuableFuture<T> anyOf(Future<? extends T>... cfs)
      Returns a new ContinuableFuture that is completed when any of the given Futures complete. If all of the given Futures complete exceptionally, then the returned ContinuableFuture also does so.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The array of input futures.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when any input future completes.

    • anyOf

      public static <T> ContinuableFuture<T> anyOf(Collection<? extends Future<? extends T>> cfs)
      Returns a new ContinuableFuture that is completed when any of the given Futures complete. If all of the given Futures complete exceptionally, then the returned ContinuableFuture also does so.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The collection of input futures.
      Returns:
      A new ContinuableFuture that completes when any input future completes.

    • iterate

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> ObjIterator<T> iterate(Future<? extends T>... cfs)
      Returns an Iterator with elements got from the specified futures, first finished future, first out.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The array of input futures.
      Returns:
      An Iterator that provides the results of the input futures as they complete.

    • iterate

      public static <T> ObjIterator<T> iterate(Collection<? extends Future<? extends T>> cfs, long totalTimeoutForAll, TimeUnit unit)
      Returns an Iterator with elements got from the specified futures, first finished future, first out.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The collection of input futures.
      totalTimeoutForAll - The total timeout for all futures.
      unit - The time unit of the total timeout.
      Returns:
      An Iterator that provides the results of the input futures as they complete.

    • iterate

      public static <T, R> ObjIterator<R> iterate(Collection<? extends Future<? extends T>> cfs, Function<? super Result<T,Exception>,? extends R> resultHandler)
      Returns an Iterator with elements obtained from the specified futures, with the first finished future being the first out. The elements are processed using the provided resultHandler function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      R - The result type of the output after applying the resultHandler function.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The collection of input futures.
      resultHandler - The function to process the results of the input futures.
      Returns:
      An Iterator that provides the results of the input futures as they complete, processed by the resultHandler function.

    • iterate

      public static <T, R> ObjIterator<R> iterate(Collection<? extends Future<? extends T>> cfs, long totalTimeoutForAll, TimeUnit unit, Function<? super Result<T,Exception>,? extends R> resultHandler)
      Returns an Iterator with elements obtained from the specified futures, with the first finished future being the first out. The elements are processed using the provided resultHandler function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The result type of the input futures.
      R - The result type of the output after applying the resultHandler function.
      Parameters:
      cfs - The collection of input futures.
      totalTimeoutForAll - The total timeout for all futures.
      unit - The time unit of the total timeout.
      resultHandler - The function to process the results of the input futures.
      Returns:
      An Iterator that provides the results of the input futures as they complete, processed by the resultHandler function.
